comments.body: can you split this to a separate test (the added code and what is needed to repro)

Just wanted to clarify here that I did not actually add a test here, I just had to change the dtypes of everything to objects. With that in mind, can you clarify what you want split out into a different test, not sure what you mean be "the added code"

Is not possible to remove all added `dtype="object"` ? The `df1` and `df2` now changed to no longer have object dtype due to the fix, but this actually seems a more correct case to test. Or does `combine_first` not handle that correctly / still return object?

Fixing the setitem bug made these datetime64ns rather than object. But then `combine_first` is buggy, as described in https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/7509.

So yes, ideally we test non-object, but https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/7509 will have to be fixed first (and shouldn't block this PR).

Ah, thanks for the pointer. Yes certainly shouldn't block the PR. 
It might be worth adding a comment explaining this here though (instead of just the github issue reference, as you need to look that up to know what it is about)
Thanks for the recommendation, updated the comment

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +225,229 @@        assert res["abc"].dtype == "datetime64[ns, UTC]"
        # Need to cast all to "obejct" because combine_first does not retain dtypes:
        # GH Issue 7509
        res = res.astype("object")
        tm.assert_frame_equal(res, exp)

        (pd.Timedelta("89 days"), pd.Timedelta("60 min")),
        (pd.Interval(left=0, right=1), pd.Interval(left=2, right=3, closed="left")),
